meanings.definition: Resembling or having the texture of cake.
meanings.sent1: The caky frosting on the cupcake looked delicious.
meanings.sent2: The bakery sold caky pastries that were soft and sweet.
meanings.sent3: The caky icing on the birthday cake made it hard to resist.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks were caky with makeup, giving her a doll-like appearance.
meanings.sent5: The caky mud in the garden was perfect for molding into shapes.

meanings.sent1: The caky dessert was a hit at the party.
meanings.sent2: The plate was caky with crumbs from the delicious cake.
meanings.sent3: The caky plate was evidence of a successful bake sale.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was caky with frosting after eating the cupcake.
meanings.sent5: The caky tray held a variety of sweet treats for everyone to enjoy.

meanings.definition: Containing a large amount of cake.
meanings.sent1: The caky box was filled with slices of different cakes.
meanings.sent2: The room smelled caky from all the baked goods inside.
meanings.sent3: The caky container was a treasure trove of sugary delights.
meanings.sent4: Her bag was caky with treats for the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The caky basket overflowed with goodies for the party.
